product.title: Hydor Professional External Canister Filter – Aquarium External Filter – Telescopic Intake Tubes, Easy Priming – EcoSystem in a Box – Biological, Mechanical, Chemical Filtration – 190 to 345 gph 350, 60-100 Gal
product.title_excluding_variant_name: Hydor Professional External Canister Filter – Aquarium External Filter – Telescopic Intake Tubes, Easy Priming – EcoSystem in a Box – Biological, Mechanical, Chemical Filtration – 190 to 345 gph
product.description: Hydor Professional External Canister Filter Whether you are a marine hobbyist or a passionate marine aquarist, know that Hydor’s Professional External Canister Filter is the perfect fit for your aquarium needs. Featuring an ecosystem in a box, this external canister filter comes equipped with telescope intake tubes, easy priming and safety locks, bringing the best of aquarium technology to your home or office. This space-saving professional external canister filter features gallon ranges from 20 to 150 and filter circulation from 160 to 290 gallons, depending upon the premium model you choose from Hydor. Use in freshwater or saltwater aquariums, knowing that this professional external canister filter can accommodate large filter volume with no water bypass. It’s simple to use and created with innovative technology. Hydor is an electromechanical company born in 1984 and has gained a reputation of high quality across the world. Hydor manufactures innovative filters, media and more in the field of aquarium technology, catering to the passionate marine aquarists. Features: - Safety Locks - Easy Priming - No Noise, Vibration - Large Filter Volume - Space Saving - Simple to Use - Telescopic Intake - No Water Bypass Package Includes: - 1 x Hydor Professional External Canister Filter Scroll up & click 'ADD TO CART' to get yours.

videos.title: Hydor Professional External Canister Filter – Aquarium External Filter – Telescopic Intake Tubes,...

feature_bullets: COMPLETE ECOSYSTEM IN A BOX: This external filter for generation aquariums offers maximum performance and high filtration standards, not to mention an entire eco-system in a box

PREMIUM VERSATILITY: This professional external canister filter for aquariums features a priming pump that offers the versatility you need. The unit is ideal for both freshwater and saltwater aquariums

SIMPLE TO USE: The long-life ceramic shaft, large filter volume and safety locks make this professional external canister filter easy to use as a beginner or a long-term hobbyist. The space-saving unit is perfect for small and large aquariums

FILTER OPTIONS: Choose from professional external canister filters that operate with gallon ranges from 20 to 150. The filter circulation stems from 160 to 290 gallons, depending upon the model you choose

SPECIALIZED SERVICE: With more than 30 years of experience offering high-quality products for the passionate marine aquarist, Hydor is dedicated to manufacturing unique and innovative items in the field of aquarium technology

top_reviews.title: This filter sucks, but so do all the rest
top_reviews.body: I have 3 of these filters now, and its hard to really say just how disappointed I am with this product. The only redeeming quality about it is that I've tried countless other filter brands and for one reason or another, they have all always failed me at some point as well. Marineland, Hydor, Fluval, you name it.  My major complaint with this particular filter has nothing to do with the filter itself and everything to do with the hose and connection points carrying water back and forth between the tank and canister. I have had leaks develop in a matter of months in all three of my filters all at various points. But all at a connection point where one of the cheap as heck red plastic washers are supposed to tighten over the hose. I have never used anything but my bare hands to tighten them down & I have become particularly paranoid about overtightening as it is such a problem with his particular brand. Yet still, just the other night I had a constant drip develop at the connection point where the output hose puts water back into the tank. I have had this same issue occur on my other filters right at the connection point that feeds into the canister itself too. It's always a slow(ish) leak that occurs so I have been able to avert disaster, but after having it happen over and over again, it's surely a design flaw. The fix could be as simple as using a metal washer! But no, then the filter might work for years at a time and you wouldn't have to continually buy new parts and products from them to keep your beloved aquatic friends alive. To be fair, these filters have always worked perfectly out of the box, it's always after a routine cleaning that leaks have developed. So I guess if you never clean your fish tank or filters, you could probably run this thing for longer without issue. But I personally need to clean my filters at least once every 3-4 weeks. After dis-assembling and re-assembling is when leaks occur. So beware!  Now up until this last leak, Hydor itself has been decent enough at replacing parts. However, this last time was a real drag. Previously all I've had to do is call them and let them know what is broken and then they send me out the replacement part. This last time I had to call, then email them with a proof of purchase, a picture of the filter sticker, and a problem description and was told that if the filter is over two years old, the part won't be replaced. Are you kidding me? Are these filters only designed to work for 2 years? What am I supposed to do when something breaks on these filters every few months? Just be out another 160 bucks? It's a sham, the only problem is no one is making a reliable product, and Hydor is at least on the cheaper end while still offering some high-end canister filter features.  It's also particularly infuriating that Hydor, unlike other companies like Marineland for example, do not offer any means of buying just the individual parts to their filter products. So when my hose breaks, I can't just buy that part. I either have to have it covered under warranty or buy an ENTIRE FILTER just to get that one piece. Talk about a scheme.  I suppose the only brand I haven't tried so far is Eheim because it's so far and away more expensive than all the rest and reading their reviews on here...they are just as prone to failure. At least with hydor I am only out 160 bucks when it fails and they haven't failed so badly to the point that I've had a massive water leak (yet) which is a positive.  Ugh, in short I guess what I'm saying is, BUY AT YOUR OWN RISK.Read more

I have 3 of these filters now, and its hard to really say just how disappointed I am with this product. The only redeeming quality about it is that I've tried countless other filter brands and for one reason or another, they have all always failed me at some point as well. Marineland, Hydor, Fluval, you name it.

My major complaint with this particular filter has nothing to do with the filter itself and everything to do with the hose and connection points carrying water back and forth between the tank and canister. I have had leaks develop in a matter of months in all three of my filters all at various points. But all at a connection point where one of the cheap as heck red plastic washers are supposed to tighten over the hose. I have never used anything but my bare hands to tighten them down & I have become particularly paranoid about overtightening as it is such a problem with his particular brand. It's always a slow(ish) leak that occurs so I have been able to avert disaster, but after having it happen over and over again, it's surely a design flaw. The fix could be as simple as using a metal washer! But no, then the filter might work for years at a time and you wouldn't have to continually buy new parts and products from them to keep your beloved aquatic friends alive. To be fair, these filters have always worked perfectly out of the box, it's always after a routine cleaning that leaks have developed. So I guess if you never clean your fish tank or filters, you could probably run this thing for longer without issue. But I personally need to clean my filters at least once every 3-4 weeks. After dis-assembling and re-assembling is when leaks occur. So beware!

Now up until this last leak, Hydor itself has been decent enough at replacing parts. However, this last time was a real drag. Previously all I've had to do is call them and let them know what is broken and then they send me out the replacement part. This last time I had to call, then email them with a proof of purchase, a picture of the filter sticker, and a problem description and was told that if the filter is over two years old, the part won't be replaced. Are you kidding me? Are these filters only designed to work for 2 years? What am I supposed to do when something breaks on these filters every few months? Just be out another 160 bucks? It's a sham, the only problem is no one is making a reliable product, and Hydor is at least on the cheaper end while still offering some high-end canister filter features.

It's also particularly infuriating that Hydor, unlike other companies like Marineland for example, do not offer any means of buying just the individual parts to their filter products. So when my hose breaks, I can't just buy that part. I either have to have it covered under warranty or buy an ENTIRE FILTER just to get that one piece. Talk about a scheme.

I suppose the only brand I haven't tried so far is Eheim because it's so far and away more expensive than all the rest and reading their reviews on here...they are just as prone to failure. At least with hydor I am only out 160 bucks when it fails and they haven't failed so badly to the point that I've had a massive water leak (yet) which is a positive.

Ugh, in short I guess what I'm saying is, BUY AT YOUR OWN RISK.

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2018

top_reviews.title: After 14 months of use, still running strong
top_reviews.body: I purchased this over a year ago after going through many canister and hang on back filters. I started with fluval, hated the hose connections and cleaning. Moved on to marineland magnum and the bio-wheels, worked ok but getting the air out after a filter clean is a nightmare. I still use the magnum filter for gravel cleaning. The tank I use this on is a 55 gallon long glass tank. The tank houses 26 cichlids, many that are 4+ inches long , they have been my pets for about 6 years so I am really attached to them and take their health seriously and that means good water quality.  The filter sets up like most canisters, an intake hose connects to a drop pipe that ends with a strainer inside the tank and another hose connects to the output side of the canister and to a return pipe you mount on the aquarium side. There is a spray bar that you can use to return the water across the surface for better surface water agitation. I don't use the spray bar because if the water level is not kept up the water splashing sound can get sort of loud, I just have the water returning out the pipe onto the surface. Priming is easy, just push down the prime button a few times and let it fill up, plug it in and let it purge the air on its own. After it is flowing I like to lightly tap the sides of the canister to cause any air to flow out.  The filter keeps the tank clean and you can use any media you like in the baskets. I use the biological media that comes with the filter, and I use sponges for particle filtration . I don't use charcoal since I go about 3 months between filter cleanings and charcoal is only good for about a few weeks tops and then it is just a barrier to water flow with no benefit.  Cleaning is easy, just remove all the baskets that stack inside and rinse the contents in non-chlorinated water (very important or you will kill the beneficial bacteria in the filter) . When they say no bypass they mean it. I had a situation where I knocked off the strainer cap on the intake. I was cleaning the filter and in the bottom basket before the first filter media I found a surprise. A baby fish ! He was all white since he had never seen daylight, about 1/4 inch long , but healthy. He is in the main tank, has full color and is about 2+ inches now !  Noise , none, it is silent . Other than washing it out ever 2 months or so and plugging it in there hasn't been any extra cost or maintenance.  If I had to say anything bad it would be the way the tubing connects to the valves, the system works but it takes a little bit of time to put together the first time.Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
I purchased this over a year ago after going through many canister and hang on back filters. I started with fluval, hated the hose connections and cleaning. Moved on to marineland magnum and the bio-wheels, worked ok but getting the air out after a filter clean is a nightmare. I still use the magnum filter for gravel cleaning.
The tank I use this on is a 55 gallon long glass tank. The tank houses 26 cichlids, many that are 4+ inches long , they have been my pets for about 6 years so I am really attached to them and take their health seriously and that means good water quality.

The filter sets up like most canisters, an intake hose connects to a drop pipe that ends with a strainer inside the tank and another hose connects to the output side of the canister and to a return pipe you mount on the aquarium side. There is a spray bar that you can use to return the water across the surface for better surface water agitation. I don't use the spray bar because if the water level is not kept up the water splashing sound can get sort of loud, I just have the water returning out the pipe onto the surface. Priming is easy, just push down the prime button a few times and let it fill up, plug it in and let it purge the air on its own. After it is flowing I like to lightly tap the sides of the canister to cause any air to flow out.

The filter keeps the tank clean and you can use any media you like in the baskets. I use the biological media that comes with the filter, and I use sponges for particle filtration . I don't use charcoal since I go about 3 months between filter cleanings and charcoal is only good for about a few weeks tops and then it is just a barrier to water flow with no benefit.

Cleaning is easy, just remove all the baskets that stack inside and rinse the contents in non-chlorinated water (very important or you will kill the beneficial bacteria in the filter) . When they say no bypass they mean it. I had a situation where I knocked off the strainer cap on the intake.
I was cleaning the filter and in the bottom basket before the first filter media I found a surprise. A baby fish ! He was all white since he had never seen daylight, about 1/4 inch long , but healthy. He is in the main tank, has full color and is about 2+ inches now !

Noise , none, it is silent .
Other than washing it out ever 2 months or so and plugging it in there hasn't been any extra cost or maintenance.

If I had to say anything bad it would be the way the tubing connects to the valves, the system works but it takes a little bit of time to put together the first time.
Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2017

top_reviews.title: Didn’t even work will review again if it’s sorted out.
top_reviews.body: I was admittedly impatient waiting for the filter. Slightly annoyed when it came with a type A socket though I ordered to the UK, when I looked back at the order there was no option for socket type although hydor have clearly told me there is that option. I ordered a converter which came promptly. However aside from the initial noise and trip of my house fuse box and a couple more trips when trying again it now does nothing. Will update hopefully this can be resolved and I can put a review of the product after actually being able to use itRead more
top_reviews.body_html:
I was admittedly impatient waiting for the filter. Slightly annoyed when it came with a type A socket though I ordered to the UK, when I looked back at the order there was no option for socket type although hydor have clearly told me there is that option. I ordered a converter which came promptly.
However aside from the initial noise and trip of my house fuse box and a couple more trips when trying again it now does nothing. Will update hopefully this can be resolved and I can put a review of the product after actually being able to use it
Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 10, 2020

top_reviews.title: Disappointing
top_reviews.body: The filter arrived without an external box and was fairly beat up from shipping. There was a small leak from the main seal after first setting it up. I managed to get it to stop leaking, but I have little confidence that it won't leak again. There really is a fair amount of water that comes out when you disconnect the hoses. This is unavoidable as it is a design flaw.  Overall, I'm am dissatisfied with this filter. For the price of this filter, there are better options.Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
The filter arrived without an external box and was fairly beat up from shipping. There was a small leak from the main seal after first setting it up. I managed to get it to stop leaking, but I have little confidence that it won't leak again. There really is a fair amount of water that comes out when you disconnect the hoses. This is unavoidable as it is a design flaw.

Overall, I'm am dissatisfied with this filter. For the price of this filter, there are better options.
Read more

top_reviews.title: Very quiet and comes complete.
top_reviews.body: Can't say enough good things about this.. Comes complete ready to go, using it on a 75 gal. Works well... Very quiet. Connectors aren't as thick as the api elbows I had... Careful when pressing hoses on.. But once on.. A nice secure locking system... And a real treat is the on off valve on the hose lines, really helps with restarting the flow. A good design.Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
Can't say enough good things about this.. Comes complete ready to go, using it on a 75 gal. Works well... Very quiet. Connectors aren't as thick as the api elbows I had... Careful when pressing hoses on.. But once on.. A nice secure locking system... And a real treat is the on off valve on the hose lines, really helps with restarting the flow. A good design.
Read more

top_reviews.title: The only issue or this is also good is that the rubber tube is transparent which you ...
top_reviews.body: It is everything as described and come with lots of filtering material. The only issue or this is also good is that the rubber tube is transparent which you can see the water and also if there is algae, you'll see that too. So, may need to find a way to clean it or find something to warp around it as my filter location is not inside a cabinet. The unplugging when cleaning the filter will have a bit of water leak as one loosen the connectors. The good thing is the starting pump. I no longer need to fill the filter to the top to fulfill a start. And I hope the best part is it will last longer especially the design seems to be more leak proof when compare to my old Fluval 305 which rely on the rubber and the formation of the base to have a good seal.Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
It is everything as described and come with lots of filtering material. The only issue or this is also good is that the rubber tube is transparent which you can see the water and also if there is algae, you'll see that too. So, may need to find a way to clean it or find something to warp around it as my filter location is not inside a cabinet. The unplugging when cleaning the filter will have a bit of water leak as one loosen the connectors.
The good thing is the starting pump. I no longer need to fill the filter to the top to fulfill a start.
And I hope the best part is it will last longer especially the design seems to be more leak proof when compare to my old Fluval 305 which rely on the rubber and the formation of the base to have a good seal.
Read more

top_reviews.title: Shiny Trap
top_reviews.body: Hi all, don't even consider buying this shiny useless thing During the second filter cleaning the sealing ring on the inner cap got broken in my hands Without it the unit DOESN'T work... I got some sealing tape on the thread, after several attempts got the unit working. Don't know for how long, though... Also, two cracks discovered in the motor body, definitely the unit wont last long  Going to try to return itRead more
top_reviews.body_html:
Hi all,
don't even consider buying this shiny useless thing
During the second filter cleaning the sealing ring on the inner cap got broken in my hands
Without it the unit DOESN'T work...
I got some sealing tape on the thread, after several attempts got the unit working.
Don't know for how long, though...
Also, two cracks discovered in the motor body, definitely the unit wont last long

Going to try to return it
Read more
